I think I know why this happens:

The [gazebo-config.cmake.in template](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/097fae5d041c79096f2f8fa2650acf119ae908f5/cmake/gazebo-config.cmake.in) has a loop over the variable `@PKG_DEPENDS@` that calls `find_package` for each dependency in that list (see [line 49](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/097fae5d041c79096f2f8fa2650acf119ae908f5/cmake/gazebo-config.cmake.in?at=default#gazebo-config.cmake.in-49)). `Boost` is added to that list in [the root CMakeLists.txt](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/097fae5d041c79096f2f8fa2650acf119ae908f5/CMakeLists.txt?at=default#CMakeLists.txt-394).

The problem is that Boost needs to be `find_package`'d with extra arguments (see [cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/097fae5d041c79096f2f8fa2650acf119ae908f5/cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake?at=default#SearchForStuff.cmake-499)). We should explicitly add `find_package(Boost)` with those extra arguments to the cmake config template.

Then we could also remove the extra `find_package(Boost)` calls from our examples, which were unknowingly working around this issue.

~~~
$ grep -rnI find_package.Boost examples
examples/stand_alone/publisher/CMakeLists.txt:4:find_package(Boost ${MIN_BOOST_VERSION} REQUIRED system filesystem regex)
examples/stand_alone/custom_main/CMakeLists.txt:5:find_package(Boost ${MIN_BOOST_VERSION} REQUIRED system filesystem regex)
examples/stand_alone/listener/CMakeLists.txt:4:find_package(Boost ${MIN_BOOST_VERSION} REQUIRED system filesystem regex)
examples/stand_alone/test_fixture/CMakeLists.txt:6:find_package(Boost ${MIN_BOOST_VERSION} REQUIRED filesystem thread system)
examples/stand_alone/animated_box/CMakeLists.txt:7:find_package(Boost REQUIRED COMPONENTS system)
examples/stand_alone/transporter/CMakeLists.txt:4:find_package(Boost ${MIN_BOOST_VERSION} REQUIRED system)
examples/stand_alone/custom_main_pkgconfig/CMakeLists.txt:4:find_package(Boost ${MIN_BOOST_VERSION} REQUIRED system filesystem regex)
examples/stand_alone/clone_simulation/CMakeLists.txt:4:find_package(Boost ${MIN_BOOST_VERSION} REQUIRED thread system filesystem regex)
examples/stand_alone/actuator/CMakeLists.txt:8:find_package(Boost ${MIN_BOOST_VERSION} REQUIRED system filesystem regex program_options)
examples/plugins/parameters/CMakeLists.txt:3:find_package(Boost REQUIRED system)
examples/plugins/animate_joints/CMakeLists.txt:3:find_package(Boost REQUIRED system)
examples/plugins/animate_joints/CMakeLists.txt:13:find_package(Boost ${MIN_BOOST_VERSION} REQUIRED system filesystem regex)
examples/plugins/projector/CMakeLists.txt:3:find_package(Boost REQUIRED system)
examples/plugins/model_move/CMakeLists.txt:7:find_package(Boost REQUIRED COMPONENTS system)

content.html:
I think I know why this happens:

The gazebo-config.cmake.in template has a loop over the variable @PKG_DEPENDS@ that calls find_package for each dependency in that list (see line 49). Boost is added to that list in the root CMakeLists.txt.

The problem is that Boost needs to be find_package'd with extra arguments (see cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake). We should explicitly add find_package(Boost) with those extra arguments to the cmake config template.

Then we could also remove the extra find_package(Boost) calls from our examples, which were unknowingly working around this issue.

$ grep -rnI find_package.Boost examples
examples/stand_alone/publisher/CMakeLists.txt:4:find_package(Boost ${MIN_BOOST_VERSION} REQUIRED system filesystem regex)
examples/stand_alone/custom_main/CMakeLists.txt:5:find_package(Boost ${MIN_BOOST_VERSION} REQUIRED system filesystem regex)

examples/stand_alone/test_fixture/CMakeLists.txt:6:find_package(Boost ${MIN_BOOST_VERSION} REQUIRED filesystem thread system)
examples/stand_alone/animated_box/CMakeLists.txt:7:find_package(Boost REQUIRED COMPONENTS system)
